DOC.HEAD: New York Times Co. Board Authorizes $50 Milion Stock Buyback
DOC.TEXT: The board of The New York Times Co. has authorized spending up to $50 million to buy its Class A common stock under a repurchase program, the company said Thursday. Chairman and Chief Executive Arthur Ochs Sulzberger said such purchases may be made in the open market or through private transactions, and that the repurchased shares will be used for various corporate purposes, including stock options and an employee stock purchase plan. The company has about 76.9 million shares of Class A common stock outstanding, and has been repurchasing its stock from time to time since 1971. In trading Thursday on the American Stock Exchange, New York Times Class A stock rose 37{ cents a share to close at $26.75.
